intro: Tragia biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered tragia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, succulent leaves. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Tragia biflora is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
